MESSAGE.name: djvudecodemain.force_bitonal
MESSAGE.value: [1-%0!05u!] Forcing gray and color to bitonal conversions.

MESSAGE.name: djvudecodemain.force_mask
MESSAGE.value: [1-%0!05u!] Forcing use of mask layer as input.

MESSAGE.name: djvudecodemain.force_gray
MESSAGE.value: [1-%0!05u!] Forcing color to gray scale conversions.

MESSAGE.name: djvudecodemain.force_bitonal_mask
MESSAGE.value: [1-%0!05u!] Forcing the use of the bitonal mask layer

MESSAGE.name: djvudecodemain.force_fg
MESSAGE.value: [1-%0!05u!] Forcing the use of the foreground layer

MESSAGE.name: djvudecodemain.force_bg
MESSAGE.value: [1-%0!05u!] Forcing the use of the background layer

BODY.MESSAGE:
Usage: %1!s! <input DjVu file> [<output xml file>]
%1!s! will create a DjVuXML file as <output xml file> from the specified <input DjVu file>. If the <output xml file> is not specified, the XML file will be writting to standard output.

Usage: %1!s! <input XML file> ...
%1!s! will parse the specified DjVuXML files, and update the referenced DjVu files.

Usage: %1!s! [--help] [--page=<page number>] <inputfile.djvu> [<outputfile.txt>]
Displays the hidden text layer of a DjVu document upon which OCR has been performed. The optional --page parameter allows extraction from a single page (1-based). --help displays this message.
Requested page does not exist in input document.
